prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 1
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 2
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: A prosecutor in Germany since age 13, she has come to America to defeat me in court.
Character 3
Name: Max
Description: A "fabulous" magician famed for his aerial illusions. Accused of murder.
Character 4
Name: Regina Berry
Description: The idol of the Berry Big Circus and daughter to Russel Berry, the Ringmaster.
Character 5
Name: Russell Berry
Description: The victim and Ringmaster of the Berry Big Circus. Regina Berry's father.
Character 6
Name: Ben
Description: Real Name: Benjamin Woodman. A ventriloquist. Conversing with him is really tiring.
Character 7
Name: Moe
Description: Real Name: Lawrence Curls. The Ringmaster's old friend, a pleasant stooge of a clown.
Character 8
Name: Acro
Description: Real Name: Ken Dingling. A star acrobat currently undergoing rehabilitation.
Character 9
Name: Bat
Description: Real Name: Sean Dingling. Bit on the head six months ago by Léon. Still in a coma.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.
Evidence 1
Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: Slightly translucent. It radiates softly with a mysterious light.
Evidence 2
Name: Crime Photo
Description: A picture of the crime scene. [caption] A person is lying face down on a big box in the snow. There are footprints leading to where he is.
Evidence 3
Name: Silk Hat
Description: Made-to-order fedora that is a symbol of Max's fabulousness. Found at the crime scene.
Evidence 4
Name: Max G. Promo Poster
Description: Emblazoned with Max's three famous symbols. A silk hat, cloak and white roses.
Evidence 5
Name: Ringmaster's Papers
Description: Documents related to Max's salary negotiations. He got an enormous raise 1 week ago.
Evidence 6
Name: Circus Map
Description: A map of the Berry Big Circus. The circus is depicted on the left. The ring master’s room and cafeteria are on the northeast of the circus. To the right is the lodging house. Moe is on the first floor and Acro is on the third.
Evidence 7
Name: Broken Bottle
Description: An orange juice bottle that was found broken on the cafeteria floor.
Evidence 8
Name: Trilo Quist
Description: A ventriloquist's puppet. An operatic tenor who doubles as Ben's sidekick.
Evidence 9
Name: Money the Monkey
Description: A monkey who takes care of Acro. Habitually gathers all sorts of shiny objects.
Evidence 10
Name: Ring
Description: A cheap ring with an eerie sparkle. "From T to R" is engraved on it.
Evidence 11
Name: Russell's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 10:15 PM. Cause: Blunt force trauma to the back of the head.
Evidence 12
Name: Wooden Box
Description: The victim was hunched over this 20 lb. box. It was locked by a small key.
Evidence 13
Name: Small Seasoning Bottle
Description: Found inside the Wooden Box the victim was hunched over. It contains pepper.
Evidence 14
Name: Grand Prix Photo
Description: Photo of Max's Award Ceremony. Max is standing at the center holding a trophy. Two girls stand to either side. The bust of max is right next to him.
Evidence 15
Name: Max G. Bust
Description: Bronze statue taken from the cafeteria before the crime. It looks rather heavy.
Evidence 16
Name: Note
Description: Posted in the Cafeteria on the day of the crime, then torn. States: "To The Murderer!" Torn by Ringmaster, found in his tailcoat pocket. Reads To The Murderer! You haven't forgotten what happened six months ago, have you? I have conclusive evidence of what took place. Meet at 10:00 PM tonight at the lodging house plaza. Found in Regina's pocket on the morning of crime. Reads To The Murderer! You haven't forgotten what happened six months ago, have you? I have conclusive evidence of what took place. Meet at 10:00 PM tonight at the lodging house plaza. Placed by Acro in Regina's pocket on morning of crime. Reads To The Murderer!

You haven't forgotten what
happened six months ago,
have you? I have conclusive
evidence of what took place.

Meet at 10:00 PM tonight
at the lodging house plaza.

Evidence 17
Name: Stage Costume
Description: A shiny spangled vest. It's not Maya's size at all.
Evidence 18
Name: Léon
Description: The animal show's lion. Shot by the Ringmaster six months ago for biting a performer.
Evidence 19
Name: Scarf
Description: Bat's scarf. Stained with his blood and a small quantity of pepper.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I suppose I could have lifted something the size of that bust.
Person: Acro
Testimony 1
Testimony: I have a strong upper body from working as an acrobat, and only my legs were injured.
Person: Acro
Testimony 2
Testimony: However, lifting the bust and looking out of the window would've been impossible.
Person: Acro
Testimony 3
Testimony: There's no way I could have exerted that kind of force on my lower body.
Person: Acro
Testimony 4
Testimony: That makes it impossible for me to have known the location of the Ringmaster's head.
Person: Acro
Testimony 5
Testimony: Thus it would be unrealistic to drop the bust on him. Don't you think?
Person: Acro

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user wants one pair, so I need to look through all the testimonies and match them against the evidences.

First, let's review the testimonies given by Acro. Testimony 0 says he could have lifted something the size of the bust. Testimony 1 mentions his strong upper body but injured legs. Testimony 2 claims he couldn't lift the bust and look out the window. Testimony 3 states he couldn't exert force on his lower body. Testimony 4 and 5 are about not knowing the Ringmaster's head location and thus couldn't drop the bust.

Now, looking at the evidences. Evidence 15 is the Max G. Bust, a heavy bronze statue. Evidence 16 is the Note, which Acro placed in Regina's pocket, luring the Ringmaster to the meeting. The autopsy report (Evidence 11) says the cause was blunt force trauma, which might relate to the bust. The wooden box (12) had a seasoning bottle with pepper, which connects to the scarf (19) with pepper stains.

Wait, Acro's testimonies 2 and 3 say he couldn't lift the bust and look out the window or use his lower body. But if he placed the note (Evidence 16), he intended to lure the Ringmaster. If the bust was used as the murder weapon, maybe he did lift it. Also, the bust was taken from the cafeteria (Evidence 15). How did he move it if he can't use his legs?

Looking at Testimony 0: Acro says he could have lifted the bust. But in Testimony 2, he says lifting and looking out the window was impossible. However, if the bust was dropped from a height, like a window, maybe he had to be at a window. But his legs are injured. Wait, the Circus Map (6) says Acro is on the third floor. If the murder happened at the lodging house plaza (from the note), maybe the bust was dropped from above. If Acro is on the third floor, he could have pushed the bust out the window without needing to move much, using upper body strength. His earlier testimony about lifting the bust (Testimony 0) says he could lift it, but Testimony 2 says lifting and looking out the window would be impossible. But if he's on the third floor, maybe he didn't need to look out? Or perhaps the contradiction is that he claims he couldn't have done it, but the evidence shows he could have.

Wait, let's cross-reference. The bust was found as Evidence 15. The murder weapon was blunt force trauma. If the bust was dropped from the third floor (Acro's room), then he could have done it. But Acro says in Testimony 2 that lifting the bust and looking out the window was impossible. But if he only needed to lift the bust (which he admits he could do in Testimony 0) and then push it out the window without needing to look out, then maybe his testimony is contradictory. Or maybe the contradiction is between Testimony 0 (can lift) and Testimony 2 (can't lift and look out). But perhaps the key is that the bust was moved from the cafeteria to his room. How? If he can't walk, maybe he couldn't have moved it. But wait, the bust was taken from the cafeteria before the crime (Evidence 15). If Acro is on the third floor, maybe someone else moved it, but he could have. Wait, but he's in rehabilitation, maybe uses a wheelchair or something. Hmm.

Alternatively, looking at Evidence 16, the note. Acro placed the note in Regina's pocket, intending to lure the Ringmaster. The meeting time was 10 PM. The Ringmaster was killed at 10:15 PM. So Acro lured him there. The murder method was using the bust. If Acro was in his room on the third floor, he could have dropped the bust on the Ringmaster in the plaza. But Acro's Testimony 2 says lifting the bust and looking out the window would be impossible. However, if he didn't need to look out the window, maybe he just pushed it out. But the contradiction is that he says he can't lift and look out, but the evidence (the note) shows he planned the meeting, implying he knew where the Ringmaster would be. Therefore, he didn't need to look out the window to know where to drop it. So Testimony 4 says he couldn't have known the location of the Ringmaster's head, but the note (Evidence 16) shows he lured the Ringmaster to a specific place at 10 PM, so he knew exactly where the Ringmaster would be. Therefore, Testimony 4 is contradicted by Evidence 16.

So Testimony 4: "That makes it impossible for me to have known the location of the Ringmaster's head." But Evidence 16 (the note) shows he set the meeting place, so he knew the location. Hence, contradiction between Evidence 16 and Testimony 4. That's the pair.
